subject: AI & Agents
title: AI Doesn't Understand Cause and Effect
description: A micro-lesson that makes AI Doesn't Understand Cause and Effect usable.

hook.text: Ice cream sales and drowning deaths both rise in summer. AI might conclude ice cream causes drowning.

buildup.text: AI excels at finding correlations â€” patterns that occur together â€” in massive datasets.

discovery.text: Correlation is not causation. AI can spot that A and B occur together, not that A causes B.

twist.text: Causal reasoning requires understanding interventions â€” what happens if you change A? AI can't do this natively.

climax.text: Causal AI is an active research frontier, but current models still confuse patterns with causes.

punchline.text: Seeing patterns everywhere. Understanding causes nowhere.

quiz.question: Why can't current AI reliably determine cause and effect?
options: It finds correlations but can't understand what happens when you intervene
AI already has perfect causal reasoning
Cause and effect don't exist in data
